>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.Item.YMGOKoZtKgJqIsAD]{Mechanic Trick}

Your drone has learned to operate vehicles quite independently. When you’re piloting a vehicle in which your drone is a passenger, you can engage @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.dXoXgaKcx2ZfBD4M.JournalEntryPage.vvdxnbL44YQeOOxr#autocontrol]{autocontrol} (or engage @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.dXoXgaKcx2ZfBD4M.JournalEntryPage.vvdxnbL44YQeOOxr#autopilot]{autopilot}, if you have the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.Item.BIUeOXScAAA53iRA]{Expert AI (Ex)} ability) as part of the action you use to drive or race, even if the vehicle doesn’t have an autocontrol or an autopilot function. If the vehicle doesn’t have an autocontrol or autopilot function, your drone must spend its actions each round to maintain the engaged function. If it’s unable to do so, the autocontrol or autopilot stops functioning. You must have a @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.Item.cA0NuGh484BwlDjX]{Drone} to select this mechanic trick.
